intro: Carex atrofusca, commonly known as black sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its dark green, strap-like leaves and produces spike-like inflorescences that bear small, three-lobed flowers. Native to wetland and marshy habitats in North America, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and filter water. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
